name: Israel
takeaway: Israel's general exposure to Chinese influence is quite low.
The three areas that received the highest score are Foreign Policy, the Military, and Economy Domains.
Most exposure to influence in these dimensions is legitimate and works in Israel's interests.
description-1: In 2023, Israel had a GDP per capita of US$52,262 and a total population of 9.19 million people.
description-2: Israel established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1992. Israel was ranked 101st in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 74/100.

Media.evidence: World Chinese Media Network is a Chinese-language media platform based in Hong Kong that targets Chinese readers in major Chinese communities worldwide. Israel has a negligible local Chinese community, which may explain why the World Chinese Media Network does not operate in the country. See their website at the attached URL under 世界华文媒体一览.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: The Belt and Road Media Community (BRMC), B&R TV Networks, and the committee of the Belt and Road News Network (BRNN) do not list any Israeli media or reporters as members on their websites.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: A delegation of Israeli journalists traveled to China in August 2023 as guests of the Chinese Enterprises Association in Israel (CEAI). Their Israeli partners were the public relations company Pe'er Levin Communications.
Media.note:
Past junkets from Freedom House's BGMI - Israel report 2022: "The most recent such trip occurred in 2019, when Erez Lin, a reporter from Israel Today, joined the delegation. Upon his return, the paper published a large feature article (in Hebrew), titled “Peace and Security, Made in China,” which uncritically repeated Chinese government talking points, framed mass re-education in Xinjiang as a potentially legitimate anti-terrorism tactic, and downplayed the authoritativeness of reports of abuse. The article included a short disclosure at the bottom stating that “the author was part of a delegation of journalists from around the world who were invited on a tour by the Chinese government to the province of Xinjiang.”

Although it remains unclear if this factor played a role, it is notable that the owners of the paper, Sheldon and Miriam Adelson, had built much of their fortune via casinos in Macau (Sheldon Adelson passed away in January 2021, leaving behind a significant legacy). Other journalists who participated in past junkets include Moav Vardi from Channel 10 News and Ronen Polak from Kol-Israel's Reshet Bet.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: To the best of the respondents' knowledge, not during the specified timeframe of January 2022 to July 2023, and never in the past.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence:
Freedom House's BGMI - Israel (draft reviewed by Tuvia Gering): The only Chinese party-state media active in Israel in Hebrew is China Radio International (CRI). The Hebrew service was launched online in 2009 during a visit to Israel by then-Director of the State Council Information Office, Wang Chen. Although the outlet does not broadcast on the radio, it has a social media presence, including a Facebook page with 130,000 followers as of July 2023, and a Hebrew-language website: https://hebrew.cri.cn/.

At the center of CRI’s outreach is Xi Xiaoqi (奚啸琪), deputy editor of the outlet’s Hebrew desk. A young and charismatic Chinese man who speaks fluent Hebrew, he is better known in Israel as “Itzik” or “Itzik HaSini” (“The Chinese Itzik”). Xi graduated from the Communication University of China in Beijing in 2009 with a major in Hebrew and joined CRI the same year as its correspondent in Israel. Over time, Xi has emerged as a media personality in his own right, being invited on primetime television talk shows to provide commentary about China. He has garnered a following of 22,600 subscribers on YouTube and 22,000 on Facebook as of July 2023. During the coverage period, local media published profiles and interviews with him, including on Channel 14, Channel 12, and a local podcast hosted by Israeli businessman Amir Gal-Or, titled "Zman Sin" ("China Time").
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: An independent Israeli media watchdog, The Seventh Eye, has been mapping media ownership structures in Israel. According to their most recent report and a conversation with their editorial team in July 2023, no Chinese or China-related entities own or partially own Israeli media outlets.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: On May 7th, 2023, Channel 12 News (N12) published a news item on their channel and social media that was produced and presented by China Radio International (CRI). The segment was hosted by CRI editor, Xi Xiaoqi ("The Chinese Itzik").
Media.note:
Beginning in 2017, the Israeli government-funded public broadcaster Kan partnered with China Radio International (CRI) to produce a series of about 20 video clips about China, covering topics such as Chinese medicine and cuisine in Chengdu, including one about Xi Xiaoqi himself. In a March 2020 article, the media watchdog website "Seventh Eye" published an investigative report revealing that CRI had paid 800,000 NIS ($230,000) for the production of the videos, which is above average for such programming. Under the agreement, Kan reportedly granted CRI joint editing and content oversight, alongside adherence to Kan’s ethical code, although the Israeli partner committed to taking into consideration “cultural sensitivities.” The credits at the end of the clips acknowledge joint production with Chinese state media but do not note that they were the primary funder of the content. Moreover, the details of the deal only emerged after a freedom of information request, the response to which was itself partly redacted by the Israeli broadcaster.

https://freedomhouse.org/country/israel/beijings-global-media-influence/2022#footnoteref12_kdy4atc
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: During the reporting period, INSS researchers reported seeing paid content from Chinese party-state media on Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence:
The Chinese Embassy in Israel issued a statement on February 8th, 2022, expressing "strong dissatisfaction and firm opposition" to "anti-China articles" about the Winter Olympics published in the Jerusalem Post. The Chinese spokesperson implied that there were "forces...behind this author," alluding to the United States. This statement was highly contentious and went against the independence of the press, which is highly valued in Israel, but it was not widely discussed in the country. When asked about the incident, a senior Israeli editor stated that the embassy had the right to complain, but it appeared they were "trying to intimidate" Israeli journalists.

In May 2022, Yaakov Katz, the editor of the Jerusalem Post, stated that after publishing an interview with Taiwan's foreign minister, Joseph Wu, he received an angry call from a senior diplomat at the Chinese embassy in Tel Aviv, who threatened to downgrade relations with Israel unless the story was removed. Katz immediately tweeted about the threat, writing on May 30th, 2022: "Needless to say, story ain’t going anywhere."

This was not the first time Katz had heard from the embassy, having received a complaint earlier in May over an op-ed by an exiled Uyghur leader and counter-op-eds by embassy representatives to editorials published in 2021 that were critical of China or its impact on Israel’s relations with the United States.
Media.note:
In July 2020, popular morning talk show host Avri Gilad delivered a live monologue acknowledging the 21st anniversary of the CCP's campaign against the Falun Gong spiritual practice, as local adherents were planning a protest in front of the Chinese embassy that day. Gilad also spoke about organ transplant abuses in China and broadly commented on the repressive nature of the regime. The Chinese embassy apparently saw the clip and quickly sent a letter of complaint, which Gilad then read on air in an effort to expose the attempt to influence his commentary.

https://freedomhouse.org/country/israel/beijings-global-media-influence/2022#footnoteref45_gom7n42

Foreign Policy.evidence: Members of the Knesset serve as heads and members in dozens of parliamentary friendship groups coordinated by the International Relations Department. China is on the list.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There is no indication of any Chinese foreign aid or donations to Israel.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In 2017, as part of the "Comprehensive Innovative Partnership" signed between Israel and China, they agreed to implement mechanisms for academic exchange, think tank dialogue, and official training. However, I did not find any indication that this article was implemented. Also, in 2017, the Chinese Academy of Governance (CAG) hosted 25 Israeli civil service students for two weeks at its expense. Following the successful visit, the CAG formalized the connection with the Israeli Civil Service Commission through an agreement that established mutual exchanges of delegations between the bodies on an annual basis. I did not find any indication that this agreement was implemented after 2020.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: China was closed until April 2023. Since then, there have been no incidents of "hostage diplomacy," and there are no indications of visa denials for Israeli citizens.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Galit Cohen, Senior Deputy Director for Planning, Policy, and Strategy at the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Director of the Program on Climate Change at the INSS, has participated for the third year in the Chinese Council for International Cooperation on Environment and Development (CCICED) Conference. Additionally, the Director General of the Ministry of Environmental Protection, Galit Cohen, serves as a special advisor to both the CCICED and the International Coalition for Green Development of the Belt and Road Initiative (BRIGC).

Academia.evidence: In May 2023, Toga Networks (a Huawei Israeli company) hosted "The 17th Israeli Networking Day," an annual event held in different locations each year. In 2021, the event was hosted by Ben-Gurion University. All Israeli universities participate in these events. Additionally, Toga is listed as one of the Technion's "Executive Partners."
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There are two Confucius Institutes in Israel: one at Tel Aviv University and another at the Hebrew University. Both focus on culture, language, literature, and related topics.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Chinese language studies are offered at high schools, and students can take a matriculation exam (Bagrut) in Chinese. Some of the textbooks were provided for free by the Confucius Institute.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence:
One of SIGNAL's partners is the Silk Road School of Renmin University (mentioned only on the Hebrew website; it does not appear on the English site).

SIGNAL is the only Jewish or Israeli organization with programs and projects across China and is a member of China’s Silk Road Think Tank Association (SRTA) under the auspices of the International Department of the Central Committee of China’s ruling Party.

The INSS joined the Silk Road NGO Cooperation Network in 2018 but has not been active in its activities.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: The University of International Business and Economics (UIBE) has opened a local branch in Israel and, as of 2021, received funding from UIBE in China, which is a PRC entity.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence:
In 2021, the "Chengdu Talent Cup" Talents Innovation and Competition awarded five winners: an independently developed smart robot system for intelligent manufacturing, a 5G base station chip with the world's lowest latency and Temi robot from Israel, a medical care revolution instigated by the development of an automated diagnostic system from Japan, and a Deep-UV LED epitaxial chip and UV light source industrialization project from the Republic of Korea. These winners will advance directly to the final ultimate contest. A total of six competing projects garnered interest from investment firms, with total intended investments reaching RMB 105 million, bringing the cumulative total to RMB 164 million.

On May 23rd, 2023, the Final of the 9th “OHTC Cup” Global Innovation and Entrepreneurship Competition for Overseas Chinese in Israel was held in Tel Aviv. This competition attracted a large number of applicants for innovation and entrepreneurship projects in the Israeli region. After preliminary selection, six projects obtained the final "entry ticket."

Prof. Haick has received the Changjiang Award (date unknown).

Academia.evidence: The University of International Business and Economics (UIBE) has opened a local branch in Israel. The students and staff go to China for a summer semester, funded by UIBE, which is partly funded by the PRC.

Domestic Politics.evidence: It is forbidden by law for parties to accept donations from foreign entities (Article 8 of the Political Parties (Financing) Law, 5733-1973). Politicians can accept donations, but according to the website of the State Comptroller of Israel, there are no donors (state-related or private) from China.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: By law, politicians and parties are not allowed to accept donations from organizations. They can accept limited sums of money from individuals, but I did not find any information about donations from Chinese sources.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Galit Distel Atbaryan, a Likud Knesset member and former Minister of Public Diplomacy ('Hasbara'), echoed Chinese talking points during a meeting with Ambassador Cai Run and announced 'media cooperation' between Israel and China. After the war in October erupted, she resigned the following month.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence:
In January 2022, Mr. Lior Farber became the Chief Executive Officer of Mivtach Shamir Energy Ltd., after working at the Prime Minister's Office for about three years. Mivtach Shamir Energy represents the Chinese company Shanghai Electric, which holds 40% of Mivtach Shamir Energy’s shares.

Mivtach Shamir has entered the electricity storage industry, with Lior Farber appointed as CEO of Mivtach Shamir Energy. The new company will focus on the electricity storage business and the exclusive representation of Shanghai Electric, one of the world's largest energy equipment companies, for the construction of storage facilities in Israel.

Additionally, Ambassador Matan Vilnai, who served as Israel's Ambassador to China until 2017, was a key figure in establishing the UIBE University branch in Israel in 2021. Vilnai now serves as the president of this branch.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence:
As of May 2023, there are three cellular network infrastructures in Israel: Pelephone, Cellcom, and PHI (a shared infrastructure for Hot and Partner companies). Each of these networks operates roughly one-third of the antennas in Israel (approximately 7,900 antennas each), and none are fully or partially owned by China.

According to media reports, the Israel Security Agency (Shin Bet) has prohibited Chinese entities from entering the Israeli media market since the installation of the 2G and 3G networks.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Each operates roughly one-third of the antennas in Israel (approximately 7,900 antennas each), and none are fully or partially owned by China.

According to media reports, the Israel Security Agency (Shin Bet) has prohibited Chinese entities from entering the Israeli media market since the installation of the 2G and 3G networks.

Technology.evidence: According to media reports, the Israel Security Agency (Shin Bet) has prohibited Chinese actors from entering the Israeli media market since the installation of the 2G and 3G networks. Additionally, the Ministry of Communications states that the frequency range of the Internet in Israel is aligned with European standards, and no relevant hardware from China has been installed.

Technology.evidence: A January 2023 report by KAN-Israeli Public Broadcasting Corporation revealed that Dahua and Hikvision cameras and security systems were discovered in recent tenders awarded by the Ministry of Transportation in the following areas: Modi'in, Kiryat Shmona, Afula, and Be'er-Sheva municipalities, a military base, Brink's (a private security company), Clalit HMO, and Bank Mizrahi-Tefahot. The report by Aharoni also uncovered the presence of Chinese technologies in Israeli police units and 'more than a few sensitive security sites.'

Technology.evidence: Israel is connected through the MedNautilus cable, owned by Telecom Italia, and the Jonah cable system, owned by the Israeli company Bezeq. Israel plans to build a submarine electricity cable to connect the power grids of Cyprus, Greece, and Israel, with the French firm Nexans awarded the contract. Additionally, Israel plans to construct a 254-kilometer (158-mile) fiber-optic cable between the Mediterranean and the Red Sea to link Europe, the Gulf, and Asia, managed by the Israeli state-owned Europe Asia Pipeline Company (EAPC).

Technology.evidence: MIGDAL HAEMEK, Israel, and SUZHOU, China, Sept. 7, 2023 – Tower Semiconductor (NASDAQ/TASE: TSEM), a leader in high-value analog semiconductor foundry solutions, and InnoLight Technology, a leader in data center optics, today announced their collaboration to develop multi-generation high-speed optical transceivers based on Tower’s Silicon Photonics process platform (PH18). With production already underway, this strategic partnership is expected to enable cutting-edge solutions to support the growing demands of AI, data centers, and next-generation telecom networks.

Technology.evidence: The Survey of Israel, under the Ministry of Construction and Housing, operates a network of permanent GNSS stations that provide national coverage. These stations are equipped with geodata antennas that receive signals from four satellite navigation systems (GPS, GALILEO, GLONASS, BEIDOU), with data recorded every second. The stations operate continuously, 24 hours a day, year-round, and transfer data in real time to the control and command center. The central system aggregates all the data and manages the services provided to various clients.

December 2022-February 2023: The Chinese embassy in Israel, the Chinese Culture Center in Tel Aviv, and the All-Israel Chinese Students and Scholars Association (全以中国学生学者联谊会, aka 全以中国学联) organized a series of online and offline events to celebrate the Year of the Rabbit.

Society.evidence:
As of July 2023, the China Association for International Exchange of Personnel (CAIEP, 中国国际人才交流协会) has a permanent representative living and working in Tel Aviv, Israel: Wang Qiang (王强). CAIEP is a front organization under the Ministry of Science and Technology that specializes in identifying and transferring talent to China. It frequently collaborates with the Israeli Chamber of Commerce - China (IsCham). Its official mission is 'promoting exchanges and cooperation between China and other countries in the fields of industry, agriculture, finance, science and technology, education, medicine, and culture through international personnel exchange activities, contributing to China's reform, opening up, and modernization, as well as the advancement of human civilization.'

On November 21, 2022, the Mediation Center of the China Council for the Promotion of International Trade (CCPIT)/China Chamber of International Commerce (CCOIC) signed a cooperation agreement with the Israeli Institution of Commercial Arbitration (founded by the Union of Chambers of Commerce, המוסד הישראלי לבוררות עסקית מייסודו של איגוד לשכות המסח). CCPIT is an organization dedicated to helping Chinese and foreign disputants resolve disputes arising out of commercial and maritime transactions.

The China Association for Science and Technology's (CAST) China Association for Promoting International Economic & Technical Cooperation (CAPC) operates a branch of the International High-Tech Research Institute (国际高新技术研究院) in Israel. CAST is a mass organization of Chinese scientists and engineers, comprising multiple national professional societies and hundreds of branches at various local and international levels.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Military.evidence: Former director of Israel’s Mossad intelligence agency, Yossi Cohen, stated, "We need to be careful not to refer to China as a challenge. We don’t want to create a confrontation with the Chinese, who do not conspire against us in any way." He also noted that China is a friendly country to Israel, with extensive trade, science, research, and technology relations.

Law Enforcement.evidence: According to the most recent official extradition treaty publication, the PRC does not have an official extradition treaty with Israel. The PRC is not on the list. The full list of Israel's extradition treaties can be found in the link below.

Law Enforcement.evidence: In December 2022, it was reported that "China has established a secret overseas police station in Israel to monitor political dissidents in the country." However, the evidence for the existence of this "police station" was weak, and Israeli officials rejected the claims.
